message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NE. 

The paper proposes a new natural language processing model that aims to form a human-like machine thinking process. It combines vision and language systems to incrementally learn the meaning and usage of numerous words and syntaxes, and ultimately enable a machine to construct fictitious 'mental' scenarios and possess intelligence. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper also involves computer vision (vision system) and machine learning (incremental learning), which make cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the paper uses LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory) networks, which are commonly used in neural networks, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category.
